messages.title: A GREEN FUTURE WITH NATALIE BENNETT
messages.content: About the EU 'leave' vote, concerns over the lack of control that 'we have over our lives and communities', supports public services, improved buses, and taking back control on issues such as making to local companies peak time profits, privatisation, fracking, poor pay, expensive and unstable housing, economic levers that benefit London, and NHS.

messages.title: AIR POLLUTION PETITION
messages.content: Sheffield Greens are calling for urgent action after the 2012 consultation failed to solve dangerous air pollution levels in Sheffield. The area including Abbeydale Road, London Road, Chesterfield Road, up to Heeley Bottom and Shalesmoor, is one of the city's worst areas for air quality.

mentions.candidate: Natalie Bennett, Green Party leader 2012-16, is making her home in Sheffield and working hard to become MP for Sheffield Central. Natalie says 'Main chance to deliver here in 2013-15 era' when field second only to the Greens MP, Brighton.

issues.brexitEurope: Frustration about the EU 'leave' vote over lack of control over lives and communities.
issues.economy: Supports public services and improving local economies by keeping peak time profits local, opposes privatisation and fracking, and is concerned about economic levers that benefit London.
issues.environment: Taking back control on issues like air pollution and protecting and enhancing green spaces in the city.
issues.health: Against privatisation, concerned about NHS stability.
issues.socialWelfare: Addressing issues of poor pay and expensive and unstable housing.

politicalExperience.achievements: Main chance to deliver environmental change here in 2013-15.

images.caption: Natalie Bennett with Green activist Sue Monroah at Zest Centre.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet contains information about local community efforts and campaigns such as tree felling and air pollution.
